ygData.subject: Re: Camping, a solution

ygData.messageBody:
You bring up a valid point. But the reason for random spawn is to make the
game more enjoyable to people as a whole. Also, the spawn would have to be
completely random in time. I Just think the spawn should be on maybe 3 or 4
different types of mobs, all around the same level, all spawning in 3 or 4
different zones, and all spawning at different random intervals. This
increases the chances the items will be around, and makes it a little more
difficult to camp it. Also, there should be more of a chance that the item
is not actually on the mob since there will be more appearing more often.

For instance, you want a rubicite breastplate. For those of us who know
what and where it comes from, its pretty easy to wait for the spawn to
appear. Then get together poeple and whack it. (dont get me wrong, its not
an easy task to kill... just to wait for it.) On the other hand, if that
same creature spawned in 3 or 4 different zones, and only spawned at random
intervals... The campers would either have to spend obscene amounts of time
sitting on one area hopping to get lucky. Or they would just have to travel
back and forth to the 3 or 4 different zones to get their kill. This also
increases the chance that the spawn will appear when they just left the zone
they were waiting in and give someone else a chance at it.

> Here is an idea that may solve camping. I agree with your analysis as to

> NPC of the same lvl, but in a different Zone. The Tommy may
> spawn in HH one

>

> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>

> Its Verant that created the campers. They have made it so that the good
> items only spawn once in a great while. These items are worth having, and
> worth spending time to obtain. So when I get strong enought to get any
> particular item I really really want, I camp the monster that
> drops it until
> I get one, and chances are that there will be someone else in my
> party that
> needs the item to, so we have to camp until they get one too, THEN we move
> on.
>
> I do admit camping is a serious problem in the game. But mainly
> the problem
> is that there are so many guilds who FARM items for their lower
> level guild
> buddies. By farming I mean camping getting their item, camping, camping,
> camping, getting their item, camping camping camping, (loop), until they
> have enough to give their entire guild.
>
> Fine example was last night in Cazic, a SK and a couple caster types were
> camping for rubicite gloves. It was rather obvious when they actually got
> them because the SKs gloves turned red. The gloves are the only item that
> this particular mob drops. After getting his gloves he continued to camp.
> Now why did he need to camp there after he got his item? THATS where the
> camping problem is.
>
> I've purposed this solution to verant on their internal beta testing beta
> board which the general public does not have access to, but nobody from
> verant even bothered to reply:
>
> Simply make it so that the higher level items can only be looted
> once by any
> given player, perhaps twice (so they can have one for trading
> purposes), or
> 4 times for items that you can use 2 of, ie earrings, rings, bracers, 1h
> weapons.
>
>
> >>> James Wofford <James.Wofford@...> 5.25.99 12:54:03 PM >>>
> From: James Wofford <James.Wofford@...>
>
> Why camp him? Why not just see if hes there, if he isnt, move on to other
> adventures. Campers are what makes this game untolerable sometimes. The
> only camping I do anylonger is camping in with a group that I
> pull for. And
> thats just normal mobs, nothing that you have to wait for a spawn
> on. Come
> on poeple, camping ruins alot of what this game is intended to be, an
> ADVENTURE.
>
> Camping for a little while is not as bad as the poeple who simply camp a
> place to farm the item over and over again. I can actually
> understand doing
> it for one person who needs the item. But doing it for money and such is
> completely inappropriate IMO.
>
> Dyvim Kincaid
> Stormriders of Cazic Thule
